title: PhotoMultiplier
description: A photomultiplier tube, useful for light detection of very weak signals, is a photoemissive device in which the absorption of a photon results in the emission of an electron. These detectors work by amplifying the electrons generated by a photocathode exposed to a photon flux

RadiantSensitivity.description: The radiant sensitivity observed with this PhotoMultiplier at peak wavelength.

Name.description: A user defined name for this Detector

Gain.description: The analog gain is the conversion unit for this detector. It specifies how many electrons correspond to 1 signal unit. It is expressed in e-/Analog-to-Digit-Unit (ADU).

Mount.description: The type of mount used for the camera.

ReadNoise.description: Read noise includes thermal noise build-up and clock induced charge. This is generally expressed in e- rms

DetectorNoiseModel.description: The noise contribution that comes from the detector

DarkCurrentRate.description: Median current detected in the absence of light. Generally expressed in e-/pixel/sec

PeakWavelength.description: The wavelength associated with maximum light intensity detected by this device

QuantumEfficiencyatPeakWavelength.description: The Quantum Efficiency observed at peak wavelength. Quantum Efficiency is generally defined as is the ratio of incident photon to converted electrons. Typically expressed as a number between 0 and 1.

AmbientOperatingTemperature.description: The ambient temperature at which this detector is designed to operate

AmbientOperatingHumidity.description: The ambient humidity at which this detector is designed to operate

SerialNumber.description: The serial number of the component

LotNumber.description: The lot number of the component

SpecsFile.description: Attach a PDF file with the specifications for the component as provided by the manufacturer

tier.description: The tier level of this component.
